section: 2.2 INITIAL INFORMATION TRANSFER MECHANISM DEVELOPMENT. The parties shall negotiate in good faith to determine the initial operation of the Information Transfer Mechanism and to describe such operation and development fees, in a statement of work ('SOW'). Each party shall make available sufficient and qualified engineers to negotiate the SOW. No SOW shall be binding on the parties unless mutually approved by both parties. In the event that the parties are unable to agree to an SOW within 2 months following the Effective Date, either party may, in its sole discretion, terminate this Agreement by providing written notice.
explanation: This section sets a 2-month deadline for agreeing on a Statement of Work (SOW). Failure to agree within this timeframe allows either party to terminate the agreement. However, Section 2.3 allows termination if the Launch Date hasn't occurred within 4 months of the effective date. The ITM is supposed to be ready by the Launch Date, but the SOW termination clause in 2.2 gives them only 2 months to complete that part, after which either party may terminate. This is an in-text contradiction because the parties can terminate earlier than expected, before they actually have time to resolve any issues. They should remove or make it longer.

section: 8.1 TERM. The term of this Agreement shall continue for one (1) year following the Launch Date, unless earlier terminated as provided herein. This Agreement may be renewed for any number of successive one (1) year terms by mutual written agreement of the parties prior to the conclusion of the term of this Agreement. A party wishing to renew this Agreement shall give the other party notice thereof no less than thirty (30) days before the expiration of the term then in effect. In the event that either party does not give such notice, the term of this Agreement shall be automatically renewed for another one (1) year.
explanation: There is an inconsistency regarding the renewal process. The first sentence requires mutual written agreement to renew, but the last sentence states that the agreement automatically renews for another year if neither party gives notice of non-renewal. This creates an in-text contradiction since both conditions cannot simultaneously be true.

section: Each party (the "Guarantor") shall protect the other party (the "Protected Party") from any and all liabilities, damages, charges, and expenditures, specifically including legal counsel payments, that the Protected Party accrues due to external grievances resulting from the Guarantor's actions, failures, or deceptive statements, provided the Protected Party is considered a key agent of the Guarantor.
explanation: This is ambiguity in text. The indemnification clause in Section 9 is unclear and potentially contradictory. It starts by stating each party (Guarantor) will protect the other (Protected Party) from liabilities arising from the Guarantor's actions, failures, or deceptive statements. However, it adds the condition that 'the Protected Party is considered a key agent of the Guarantor'. This condition significantly limits the scope of indemnification. The statement that only key agents can be Protected is a very high burden for protection and unclear. It creates ambiguity about under which circumstances this indemnification applies and opens the door for disputes.
